title: Identify outliers of resting heart rate age groups

content.description:
Resting heart rates, in beats per minute, were recorded for two samples of people. One sample was from people in the age-group of <math alttext="20" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>20</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> years to <math alttext="30" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>30</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> years, and the other sample was from people in the age-group of <math alttext="40" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mn>40</mn> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> years to <math alttext="50" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mn>50</mn> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> years. The five-number summaries are shown in the table.

Age-Group (years)
 Minimum
 <math alttext="Q 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Q</mi><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 Median
 <math alttext="Q 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Q</mi><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 Maximum

<math alttext="20" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>20</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="30" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>30</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="60" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>60</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="71" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>71</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="72" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>72</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="75" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>75</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="84" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>84</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="40" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>40</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="50" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>50</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="60" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>60</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="70" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>70</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="73" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>73</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="76" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>76</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="85" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>85</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

The values <math alttext="60" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>60</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="62" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>62</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="84" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>84</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> were common to both samples. The three values are identified as outliers with respect to the age-group <math alttext="20" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>20</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> years to <math alttext="30" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>30</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> years because they are either <math alttext="1.5" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> times the interquartile range <math alttext="I Q R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">Q</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">R</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> greater than the upper quartile or <math alttext="1.5" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> times the <math alttext="I Q R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">Q</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> less than the lower quartile.
content.question: Using the same method for identifying outliers, which of the three values are identified as outliers for the age-group <math alttext="40" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mn>40</mn> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> years to <math alttext="50" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mn>50</mn> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> years?

choices.label: None of the three values is identified as an outlier.
Only <math alttext="60" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>60</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> is identified as an outlier.

Only <math alttext="60" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>60</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="62" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>62</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> are identified as outliers.

Only <math alttext="60" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>60</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="84" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>84</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> are identified as outliers.
The three values are all identified as outliers.

content.answer: Only <math alttext="60" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>60</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> is identified as an outlier.

topic.text: 1.7: Summary Statistics for a Quantitative Variable

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Interpret statistical calculations and findings to assign meaning or assess a claim.
